decks.notes: This deck revolves around quickly getting Allosaurus Rider onto the battlefield through Neoform or Eldritch Evolution to then combo off with Nourishing Shoal and Griselbrand to draw through the entire deck and win the game. The main focus is on generating mana and assembling the combo pieces efficiently while also having backup plans in place with additional win conditions like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast Primeval Titan and search for key lands such as Gruul Turf and Lotus Field. By using cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact, the player can tutor for specific cards to set up game-winning combos. The deck also includes utility lands like Mirrorpool and Vesuva to further enhance the player's board presence. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently ramping up mana production and quickly assembling a powerful board state to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a wide board presence with efficient creatures and using spells like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to protect them. By utilizing powerful cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt provide reach and removal options to close out the game. With a solid mana base and a mix of aggro threats, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a powerful board presence without relying on traditional land cards. By combining control elements with powerful creatures and artifacts, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a strategic use of resources and proactive gameplay. The deck emphasizes flexibility and adaptability, able to adjust its game plan based on the opponent's actions and successfully execute its combo potential.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to utilize cards like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal quick damage, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Blood Moon. The inclusion of Seasoned Pyromancer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury allows the deck to maintain card advantage and continue applying pressure. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride, the deck can quickly close out games and secure victories.

This Boros Aggro deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Cards like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide early pressure, while cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment offer ways to close out the game if it goes longer. The deck also includes some control elements like Static Prison and Elegant Parlor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be fast and relentless, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures into play by combining the reanimation ability with spells like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to put creatures in the graveyard, and then use spells like Unearth and Persist to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes a number of control elements like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control elements to secure victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to deal fast damage, supported by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Preordain and Expressive Iteration to maintain consistency. The key strategy is to apply early pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot, using burn spells to finish off the opponent when needed.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls provide a fast clock while Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge help deal with opposing threats. The deck also utilizes cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory to generate card advantage and maintain pressure. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent casting of spells. The overall strategy is to be proactive and relentless in attacking the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to protect creatures and enhance their abilities. Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach, while Stubborn Denial offers protection against opposing spells. Consign to Memory can provide card advantage and removal, while Arena of Glory allows for additional creature recursion. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a good mix of lands and colors.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Sire of Seven Deaths to quickly close out the game once it has established control. The goal is to efficiently ramp up mana and disrupt the opponent's plans while deploying powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, Eye of the Storms, and Karn, the Great Creator. Along with control elements like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a dominant board presence. The inclusion of cards like Mystic Forge and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional utility and card advantage, making it a versatile and potent control deck in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to gain extra land drops. Primeval Titan serves as a key card to search for and put into play additional lands, enabling combos with cards like Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck aims to control the game by setting up a strong board presence and using lands and combos to overwhelm the opponent with explosive plays.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal spells. It aims to control the board and protect its own threats while eventually winning the game with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also utilizes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog to generate card advantage and maintain control of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's powerful spells and allow for flexibility in casting multiple colors of spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield quickly. Ephemerate and Faithful Mending help dig for combo pieces while Prismatic Ending and Force of Negation provide protection and disruption. The inclusion of cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler add additional utility and ways to control the game. Overall, the deck aims to quickly reanimate key threats and win the game through powerful combos and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells, such as Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, to disrupt the opponent's strategy and dominate the battlefield. Additionally, cards like All Is Dust and Warping Wail provide removal and protection, allowing the deck to maintain control while applying constant pressure on the opponent.
